plan-and-build.description: Break down requirements into tasks, then coordinate implementation. Both agents loop until they signal completion or reach max iterations.

quick-pipeline.description: Run agents in sequence, once each (no looping). Useful for simple workflows where each step runs to natural completion without iteration limits.

single-task.description: Work on one specific task. Uses variable substitution to pass TASK_ID from environment or CLI args.

mixed-mode.description: Manager runs once to create/update tasks, then coordinator loops to implement them. Demonstrates combining looping and non-looping steps.

full-tdd-cycle.description: Complete TDD workflow: plan tasks, then coordinate implementation with TDD practices.

design-then-build.description: Design exploration followed by implementation. Riff agent runs once to explore design, then coordinator implements.
